page.title: 03How W W II changed the area
page.content: To the north of the block, Seighford Aerodrome was developed during the war. The war had a dramatic effect on local life. The normally peaceful rural area was disrupted by noise from planes and the occasional crash or other mishap. Seighford Aerodrome changed from a training ground to an operational airfield with Halifax and Wellington bombers leaving on their nightly missions. Italian and German Prisoners of War worked on local farms. A number were billeted with local farmers and became trusted and respected members of the community. Many married local girls and their families still live in the area.
